Material used.Description: Basal cell viability was assessed following expression of deletion mutants and complete gene counterparts.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of deletion mutants resulted in significantly less decrease in basal cell viability as compared to their complete gene counterpart. Data are means Â± SEM, at least 12 readings per data point, from three independent experiments. * p < 0.05 versus basal cell viability of cells expressing the corresponding complete gene.

Technical replicates.Description: At least 12 readings per data point.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a control.

Basic negative control.Description: pCDNA3.1 vector alone was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and post hoc Fisher's protected least significant difference (PLSD) tests were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Viability of cells transfected with pCDNA3.1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly less decrease in basal cell viability as compared to cells expressing the corresponding complete gene (p < 0.05).

Material used.Description: H2O2-induced cell death was assessed in cells expressing wild-type LRRK2, Y1699C mutant, or their corresponding deletion mutant.

Readout description.Result Description: Attenuation of H2O2-induced cell death for cells expressing deletion mutants as compared to their complete gene counterpart.

Technical replicates.Description: At least 12 readings per data point.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a control.

Basic negative control.Description: pCDNA3.1 vector alone was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and post hoc Fisher's protected least significant difference (PLSD) tests were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Viability of cells transfected with pCDNA3.1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly less decrease in basal cell viability as compared to cells expressing the corresponding complete gene (p < 0.05).
